BlackPoint.cause: Fungal infection by Alternaria and Bipolaris species due to high humidity during grain filling.
cure: Harvest at proper moisture to avoid kernel darkening.
Store grains in a dry, aerated place.

FusariumFootRot.cause: Fusarium fungus infects the crown and roots under dry and warm soil conditions.
cure: Rotate crops with legumes or oilseeds for 2 years.
Treat seed with carbendazim or tebuconazole.
Avoid soil compaction and improve drainage.

LeafBlight.cause: Fungal disease caused by Alternaria triticina or Helminthosporium spp. in humid conditions.

WheatBlast.cause: Caused by Magnaporthe oryzae affecting wheat heads in warm, humid climates.
cure: Destroy infected residues and avoid wheat after rice.

BacterialBlights.cause: Caused by Xanthomonas albilineans bacteria during humid weather and mechanical injuries.

Mosaic.cause: Viral disease transmitted by aphids, causing mottled leaves.

RedRot.cause: Fungal disease caused by Colletotrichum falcatum, infecting stalks and setts.
cure: Dip setts in carbendazim 0.1% before planting.

Rust.cause: Fungal disease caused by Puccinia melanocephala in humid weather.

Yellow.cause: Phytoplasma or virus spread by leafhoppers causing yellowing of leaves.

blast.cause: Caused by Magnaporthe grisea fungus under warm and humid conditions.

rust.cause: Fungal disease caused by Puccinia substriata under moist conditions.

Apple___Apple_scab.cause: Fungus Venturia inaequalis infects leaves and fruits during wet spring weather.

Apple___Black_rot.cause: Botryosphaeria obtusa fungus infects twigs and fruit under warm, humid conditions.
cure: Prune infected twigs and burn debris.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.cause: Caused by Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae fungus, spreads from juniper to apple.

cure: Maintain orchard hygiene and balanced nutrition.
Maintain balanced soil pH and pruning.

Cherry___Powdery_mildew.cause: Fungus Podosphaera clandestina affects leaves and shoots in humid conditions.

Corn___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_leaf_sp.cause: Fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis infects leaves during humid weather.

Corn___Common_rust.cause: Fungal disease caused by Puccinia sorghi.

Corn___Northern_Leaf_Blight.cause: Fungus Exserohilum turcicum infects leaves in moist, cool weather.

Grape___Black_rot.cause: Fungus Guignardia bidwellii infects leaves and berries in humid weather.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).cause: Fungal disease by Phaeomoniella chlamydospora in mature vines.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.cause: Caused by Isariopsis spp. fungus in humid conditions.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).cause: Bacterial disease spread by psyllid vectors.
cure: Control psyllids using neem oil or imidacloprid.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.cause: Xanthomonas campestris bacteria infect leaves and fruits.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.cause: Caused by Xanthomonas vesicatoria under warm, moist conditions.

cure: Ensure crop rotation and balanced nutrients.

Potato___Early_blight.cause: Alternaria solani fungus infects leaves and tubers.

Potato___Late_blight.cause: Phytophthora infestans fungus under cool, moist weather.

cure: Maintain good air circulation and sanitation.
Practice crop rotation and use resistant varieties.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.cause: Fungus Podosphaera xanthii affects leaves under dry, warm conditions.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.cause: Fungal infection by Diplocarpon earlianum causing necrotic leaf spots.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.cause: Caused by Xanthomonas campestris bacteria in moist, warm climates.

Tomato___Early_blight.cause: Alternaria solani fungus causes leaf spots in warm conditions.

Tomato___Late_blight.cause: Phytophthora infestans fungus during cool, wet weather.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.cause: Fungus Passalora fulva under high humidity in greenhouses.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.cause: Fungus Septoria lycopersici infects lower leaves.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.cause: Caused by Tetranychus urticae mites under hot, dry conditions.

Tomato___Target_Spot.cause: Fungal disease caused by Corynespora cassiicola.

Iris yellow virus.cause: Viral infection spread by thrips or aphids.

Stemphylium leaf blight and collectrichu.cause: Fungal infection by Stemphylium vesicarium and Colletotrichum species.

purple blotch.cause: Alternaria porri fungus infects leaves under humid weather.

Bacterialblight.cause: Xanthomonas oryzae bacteria infect leaves through wounds and water splashes.

Brownspot.cause: Bipolaris oryzae fungus infects leaves and grains in humid weather.

Leafsmut.cause: Entyloma oryzae fungus infects leaves in high nitrogen conditions.

Caterpillar.cause: Caused by larvae of moth species such as Helicoverpa armigera or Spodoptera litura feeding on leaves and fruits.
cure: Handpick and destroy larvae and egg masses.
Spray neem oil 5% or Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt).
In severe cases, spray emamectin benzoate or chlorantraniliprole.

Diabrotica speciosa.cause: Beetle pest that damages roots and leaves of maize, beans, and cucurbits.
cure: Rotate crops with non-host plants like legumes.
Apply soil insecticide such as imidacloprid or thiamethoxam.
Use neem-based sprays for adult beetles.
Maintain field sanitation by removing weeds and residues.
Maintain proper nutrition and field hygiene.
Regularly monitor crops for early pest detection.

bacterial_blight.cause: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzae, favored by high humidity and rain.
cure: Use resistant varieties like IR64 or Samba Mahsuri (sub1).
Avoid overhead irrigation and standing water for long periods.
Spray copper oxychloride or streptocycline mixture.
Remove and destroy infected plant debris.

curl_virus.cause: Caused by Begomovirus transmitted by whiteflies under warm and dry conditions.
cure: Control whiteflies using imidacloprid or neem oil sprays.
Remove and destroy infected plants early.
Keep fields free from weed hosts.

fussarium_wilt.cause: Fungal infection by Fusarium oxysporum in warm, poorly drained soils.
cure: Use resistant varieties and disease-free seeds.
Apply Trichoderma viride to soil or seed.
Ensure good soil drainage and crop rotation.
Treat seeds with carbendazim 2g/kg before sowing.
Provide adequate irrigation and pest monitoring.
